words.definition: An alternative is something that you can choose instead of your first choice.
words.example: Her first plan seemed weak, so she chose an alternative.

words.definition: An avenue is a road, often a large one with buildings on each side.
words.example: Drive down this avenue and then turn left to go to the park.

words.definition: The belly is the stomach of a person or animal.
words.example: His belly was full because he ate a lot of food.

words.definition: A bid to do something is an attempt to do it.
words.example: He made a bid to become the universityâ€™s next president.

words.definition: To blow means to move air, like the wind does.
words.example: The wind blew the leaves across the yard.

words.definition: A conflict is a fight or a disagreement.
words.example: The two countries were in a conflict over land.

words.definition: A continent is one of the seven large areas of land on Earth.
words.example: Asia is the largest continent in the world.

words.definition: A current is the steady movement of water or air in one direction.
words.example: The river's current was very strong.

words.definition: Disrespect is a lack of respect for someone.
words.example: He showed disrespect by not listening to his teacher.

words.definition: Enthusiasm is a feeling of great excitement and interest.
words.example: The kids showed a lot of enthusiasm for the trip.

words.definition: If something is harsh, it is very unpleasant or difficult.
words.example: The winter weather was very harsh this year.

words.definition: To lean means to bend your body in a particular direction.
words.example: She leaned forward to hear what he was saying.

words.definition: The meantime is the time between two events.
words.example: The bus will be here soon. In the meantime, let's wait inside.

words.definition: Mischief is behavior that is playful but can cause trouble.
words.example: The little boy was always getting into mischief.

words.definition: A muscle is a part of the body that helps you move.
words.example: He has very strong muscles because he exercises.

words.definition: To rescue someone means to save them from danger.
words.example: The firemen rescued the family from the burning house.

words.definition: A succession is a number of things that happen one after another.
words.example: There was a succession of loud noises from the street.

words.definition: Terrain is the physical features of an area of land.
words.example: The rocky terrain made it difficult to hike.

words.definition: If someone is timid, they are shy or easily frightened.
words.example: The timid kitten hid under the sofa.

words.definition: Violence is physical force that is used to hurt someone.
words.example: There was a lot of violence in the movie.
